text: Zinc iodide is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is ZnI2. It contains zinc and iodide ions. == Properties == Zinc iodide is a colorless solid. It dissolves in water. It reacts with bases to make zinc hydroxide. It is a reducing agent. When it is oxidized it makes iodine. == Preparation == It is made by reacting zinc with iodine. == Uses == It is opaque (not clear) to X-rays. It can be used as a stain in microscope slides. == Related pages == *Zinc fluoride *Zinc bromide *Zinc chloride Category:Zinc compounds Category:Iodine compounds
